page.title: 05VISIT TO BATTYE ST. INFANTS
page.content: Ten pupils from Class 4 of Holy Spirit R.C. School visited Battye Street Infants School to talk to ten Asian children in Form 3.The area around our school has a large Asian population. All the Asian children live within walking distance of Battye Street, and most have relatives living nearby. The family size varies from five to ten, and only one home had a pet. Their favourite subjects, food, and their favourite television programmes are similar to those of our children, as are their games. All the children are Muslims and attend the Mosque in the evening reading the Koran. They all speak English although five children spoke no English on admission to the school. They speak Urdu or Punjabi at home. All the fathers speak English but only four of their mothers. Six children had recently visited Pakistan
